headline: Grilled Chicken Adobo
description: Dark chicken thigh meat is cooked in a rich soy sauce, garlic, and vinegar mixture, then tossed on the grill until crisp. Serve over rice.
name: Grilled Chicken Adobo

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat, and lightly oil grate.
In a large pot, mix soy sauce, water, vinegar, honey, garlic, bay leaves, and pepper. Bring the mixture to a boil, and place the chicken into the pot. Reduce heat, cover, and cook 35 to 40 minutes.
Remove chicken, drain on paper towels, and set aside. Discard bay leaves. Return the mixture to a boil, and cook until reduced to about 1 1/2 cups.
Place chicken on the prepared grill, about 5 minutes on each side, until browned and crisp. Serve with the remaining soy sauce mixture.

review.reviewBody: Use low sodium soy sauce.. Salty

So I had a friend that grew up overseas and they taught me their version of Chicken Adobo. I use chicken with skin and saute until browned. The ingredients of this dish pair well along with banana peppers on the side. I would suggest adding a 1/2 lemon for acidity to even out the flavor. Over all..... Not bad:)

Basically soy marinated chicken. Don't bother with the honey or bay leaves- the overwhelming flavor is soy sauce. And the sauce that gets reduced at the end is sooo salty, even with low sodium soy - -when you are boiling down the soy sauce, the salt stays As someone else pointed out, the braising and the grilling times are enough to cook the chicken. Time reduction on both might help.
Good recipe overall. I thought because so much soy sauce it was going to be too salty but it actually wasn't, it was very flavorful.

This will work with Pork ribs, Beef ribs or steaks and chicken pieces...

It is also part of my culture from being an Pacific Islander...
Too Salty. Almost inedible. I even on put 1/2 of the liquid on the chicken, still way too salty.
yes, I didn't read the remarks till after I made it, with regular soy sauce it is overly salty, I'll have to try it again with less soy sauce
So delicious!!!

Boot leather if you follow the timing and use the mechanically bones and skinned thighs from the store (costco in this instance). Grilling gives a nice texture, but timings for each part of the recipe (simmer then grill) are almost enough in themselves to cook the chicken. And too much liquid for the quantity of chicken.
I can't even put into words how good this is! Delicious!
I can't even put into words how good this is! Delicious!
Very easy and came out extremely tender. Used boneless, skinless thighs. Added liquid smoke and Worcestershire sauce as well. Did put under broiler for a bit but don’t think I would the next time.
Made it twice, & it's our new fav way to make thighs.
It was too cold to grill so I made this in a skillet and it came out wonderful! I've made this a few times now and it's a favorite!

Made it with low sodium soy sauce. Make sure you spray your tablespoon with cooking spray to make measuring the honey easier. Crowd favorite. Every time I've made it people have asked for the recipe. I put it over copycat Chipotle Chilantro Lime Rice.
Fantastic. Admittedly I added sesame oil, sesame seeds and a few tps of crushed red pepper. My additions are more my suiting. But the over all product was very tasty.
good

everyone in the family competes with my brother's chicken adobo because he makes amazing adobo. this recipe finally won me my daughter's vote in being better than her uncle's! this was Filipino winner winner chicken dinner lol.

What is the preferred type of vinegar to use in this recipe? I haven't made this recipe yet but I gave it 4 stars so I wouldn't skew the ratings. Wish submitters would list either brands or specific types of ingredients so I have a better chance for a positive outcome! Thanks

Came out so delicious . I found that I didn't like it with too much vinegar because It was overwhelming so I just added some more soy sauce and brown sugar instead of just honey and it came out wonderful . I grilled half and the other half I just ate with some white rice . So much flavor!
The best I've had in a long time. I increased water and cooked uncovered, sauce thickened on its' own. This is also good with pork shoulder, cut in cubes and increase cook time till tender.
I found that the soy sauce was too much. I will try again I cooked the chicken to 40 Min and was perfect.
Saltier than the Great Salt Lake.

Prepared as written except for serving with sauce. We enjoyed it with corn on the cob instead of rice. It's already added to my favorites. Easy to prepare with ingredients on hand and enjoyed by entire family.
I added some Dijon and twice as much garlic. Was a big hit in my family! Will make again!

Liked it a lot. Served it with brown rice and steamed broccoli. After removing the chicken, I spiced up the sauce with a little chipotle pepper sauce and thickened it with cornstarch and served it in little dipping bowls... we dipped the grilled chicken and broccoli in it.

My husband and son are VERY particular about how chicken is cooked, especially our 9 year old son. They both devoured it and our son asked for seconds! Very juicy and tender, no knife needed to cut it! 
Of course it's January and it's snowing so we couldn't use our grill so we tossed it into the oven afterwards at 350 degrees for a little bit. 
Amazing...Just amazing!

I brown the chicken first stove top, then set aside. Combine the remaining ingrediants are described. Then return the chicken back to the pan. Attention: Try Philippine soy sauce has the least amount of sodium,700mg as to 1.100-1.200mg found in popular grocery store brands.
Flavor was wonderful.

This was one of the first recipes that I did when I first started cooking. I have altered a few things since then. But it one of families favorite meals. My secret is after I boil the chicken I add caramel to the skin and then broil it till skin starts to brown.
It was okay but I don't think id make it again. Too many recipes I like better

I make almost the exact same adobo mix but instead of cooking the chicken in the mix, I marinate the raw chicken breasts or thighs for about 1-2 hours, then grill the chicken on the barbecue. It might still be a little salty for some, but adding some water would probably cut some of that. The chicken comes out dynamite and it's much less salty that way. Everyone I've ever made this for raves!
I have had adobo chicken before, first time making it; I think it needed more vinegar, less honey
Good Recipe....i need to try this again and use chicken thigh meat...

I didn't get to marinate this but about 20-30 minutes so it didn't have quite as much flavor as I would've liked, but marinating it longer would probably make it a 5 star recipe for me so I'm going to go ahead a and give it 5 stars.

This was excellent. I followed reviewers' advice and cut the soy sauce to 1 cups while upping the water to 3 cups. I also added a dash of liquid smoke which gave it fabulous flavor. I only had bone-in chicken, so I put five chicken thighs in the sauce (turning them in middle so they all should be submerged at some point) and cooked for 40 minutes. Then I transferred to a pan and broiled in the oven for five minutes. I boiled the sauce a little more to reduce and then spooned some over the chicken, as well as over the rice and broccoli I served as sides. The house smelled fabulous and the whole family loved this supper.

I like one reviewer over cooked the chicken, but the taste was great. For the sauce, I did as one person wrote and decrease the soy sauce to 1 cup, increased the water to 2 cups and used rice vinegar.

This is a new family favorite. Definitely use low salt soy sauce. In winter when it's too cold to grill we just pull the chicken out after it's done cooking. We shred it and throw it in a pan and stir fry it with some rice. Thanks
Very tasty. Just the right combination of flavors, without being overpowering. I used boneless skinless thigh meat, and made foil packets to bake in the oven. Came out moist, and flavorful.

This was a pretty tasty recipe, but even with the soy sauce cut down, it was still too salty for our tastes. Next time, I will only put in 1/2 c of soy sauce and 3 c of water. Also, I didn't have any honey so I substituted 3 T brown sugar.

I used low sodium soy sauce, and a little less than called for. I used rice vinegar and more garlic. Instead of grilling, I broiled the chicken for about 4 minutes. I reduced the sauce until it was pretty thick. The flavor concentrates quite a bit so... do as told by the submitter: "serve with just a little of the sauce, not too much". Very tasty!
Wonderful flavor! Halved the soy sauce, doubled the water. Returned the grilled, cooked chicken to the reduced sauce for a few minutes to infuse the flavor again. Wonderful!
Great recipe as is.

Cut the recipe down to 2 servings and followed it to a T, except for using only 1/4 cup soy sauce and making up for the missing liquid by using 1/2 cup water. It was perfect this way. I let the chicken marinade in the sauce for a few hours before cooking it, and it came out moist and flavorful.
Really good!! The chicken was super tender!
I give this 4 stars not because of the taste, but because I found boiling the meat first made the chicken "pasty" and a weird texture

Loved this chicken - only reason that I gave 4/5 is that the sauce was wayyyy too salty. And I am a saltaholic. Maybe the soy I used, not sure. Once I reduced, it was inedible b/c of the sodium. I used a tiny portion and added water, and just LIGHTLY brushed it on top when I grilled. I loved the result - flavorful and somewhat healthier than with all the sauciness.
We loved this!! Trimmed off all the fat, halved the soy sauce, and did not grill. Was wonderful, will make again.

ABSOLUTELY DEEE-LISH!!! Since I don't have the luxury of an outdoors BBQ, I just broiled it on the top shelf of my oven for 3 minutes on each side. The house had the "just-as-if" smell of a wood BBQ. The chicken was super tender, and a huge success with my picky better half. Thanks so much for sharing. :-)
This was delicious! The entire family loved it. And it was very quick and easy to make.
My very picky husband LOVED this! It was delicious!! It's nice to eat something healthier that's so tasty!!
Amazing! I didn't use as much soy sauce because I ran out but still was amazing! Reminded me of bourbon chicken from the mall but better!
Excellent. I added salt and pepper as well as a few shakes of worcestershire sauce. My 13 yr old son devoured it. I will make this again for sure.
This is super yummy. We used chicken thighs with the bones in. The sauce didn't get thick enough for our taste, so I added a bit of a cornstarch/water mixture, which worked perfectly.
I have nothing to compare this to. All I can say is that this was a wonderfully tasty recipe. I found it delicious just as it was and did not change a thing.

I almost felt like I was back in Manila...only thing I did different is use Agave nectar instead of honey. I was out of honey at the time. I did use palm vinegar also since I have a Philippine grocery store close to me.
Love this dsih and so my picky family; one of our favorite!

This was easy, tasty and did not make every dish in my kitchen dirty. Three things I greatly appreciate in a recipe. The taste was wonderful. I omitted the bay leaves, used slightly more garlic and could only find bone-in, skin-on chicken thighs (of which I removed the skin before using). The meat practically fell off the bone!

Followed recipe exactly except using organic low sodium tamari and low sodium rice vinegar. We grilled them too long in the end and dried them out but still delicious. Next time we will grill on medium and until they look crispy but not charred. Our fault not the recipe. Will make this one again. served with cilantro lime rice recipe (my cilantro had gone bad in fridge) so it was just lime rice but still good! Sauce reduced fine on high heat while grilling the meat but it didn't thicken up like gravy, not that I expected it to.

This was wonderful. I can see why some would say it is too salty - however, we didn't fee like it was. I would recommend cutting down the soy a bit though. You can always add more saltiness but you can't get rid of it once its there. Try it with 1 cup rather than 1 1/2. I used rice vinegar and would recommend trimming the fat off the thighs before cooking. Fantastic recipe. I served it with "roasted beets n sweets" from this recipe and it paired beautifully.
I thought the sauce had an excellent flavor. I used rice vinegar and low sodium soy sauce. We opted not to grill just because it was raining, but I will try it that way next time. Thanks.
This recipe was good, but not something that I would want to add to my menu rotation.We were worried that it would be a little salty so we added half a cup more water and it helped a lot.
This was very good. A little on the salty side, but overall very tasty. We added a little butter and flour to the sauce at the end to finish and thicken it.
The flavor was stellar, though i used chicken breast and overcooked it slightly, but that was my fault.

I halved the recipie because their were only two of us, omited the bay leaves as I didn't have any and used about half regular half low sodium soy sause. Still my guy and I really liked the chicken but the sause never really tightened up at all and was really salty. I'll definatly make the chicken again, but will proably skip the sause.

Very yummy. Didn't think it tasted too salty. I think I like it better not grilled. I put a couple of the pieces on the Forman since it's too cold outside. I prefer the ungrilled pieces of chicken. Will def add to our meal rotation!

ok, sooo good. I made the sauce first.. reduced for about 20 min, then cooled. then put half on chicken to marinate for 8 hr. I then grilled the (boneless/skinless breasts) and drizzled the remaining sauce over. my other modifications were 1/2 tsp cayenne and 2 tsp brown sugar to the original marinade. So awesome and easy!!!

I thought this was very good. I reminded me of the mall's bourbon chicken. I love knowing that I could grill quickly since the chicken thighs were already cooked. I served it with a side of fried rice and steamed broccoli.
Love this Chicken!! Taste like the chicken I use to get from a restaurant! Will make again....my one year and two year old loved this and that says a lot.
This doesnt taste like I remember adobo tasting like

Excellent and easy! My husband and kids all LOVED it. The aroma in the kitchen was mouth watering from the very beginning. We made the recipe exactly as stated except cut back on the soy sauce. We also used apple cider vinegar. Try this- while the chicken is on the grill, cut up some broccoli and toss it into the boiling sauce. Very delicious and will definitely make this again! Would be a crowd pleaser when company comes over.

I messed this up, but it still tasted great. Followed the recipe as written until the end, when i left the pot of marinade unattended and burned it so couldn't use it. Also didn't bother to grill the chicken. Still thought it was good! Some sauce would have been nice, will try this one again.
Very bland. A little to dry and we used chicken thighs which are typically not dry. Didn't like the sauce. Sorry.
Very bland. A little to dry and we used chicken thighs which are typically not dry. Didn't like the sauce. Sorry.

I was stuck with "Kikkoman Lite" so after getting 3 spoon fulls of old drying up honey I put in probably a spoon or 2 of brown sugar. Though I could see the oil sitting up top the sauce, it didn't taste oily to me or my dad, came out very well. Sauce made everything else we made taste better XD

this was great!! but having made adobo before i knew to watch that soy sauce, it will become way to salty. was great on the grill, but will boil for less time next time. it makes the chicken so tender it falls apart on the gill. Thanks for sharing, loved it!!!

Used 1 c soy sauce and 2 cups water. Wasn't too salty with this ratio. I was disappointed with the end result. With such good rating and reviews i was expecting something better. Won't be making this again.

I didn't care for this chicken. I feel that the boiling time may be too long. My husband and I really thought the chicken was dried out. My daughter however loved it saying, "juicy chicken is gross!" haha so I guess if you are like my fifteen year old this is for you!
Thanks for a great new chicken recipe!!!!
Delicious! :)

I was very excited to give this chicken a try. It looked wonderful. I have to stress the fact that ordinary soy sauce is WAY TOO SALTY for this dish. The chicken itself had a nice flavour aside from the salt content. I will make this again someday, but will either half the soy sauce or buy the kind suggested in a previous post.
Not to my taste. It was too salty... a little too much soy sauce. I tried the leftovers the next day in chicken wrap; to no avail... it simply had no substance.

This was incredibly easy and delicious. The only problem that I saw with the recipe is that it doesn't indicate what kind of vinegar to use so I used white vinegar. It worked well. Balsamic vinegar may have been over powering, but I'm not sure, it could have gone nicely with the flavors. I also used low sodium soy sauce. A little bit of the sauce goes a long way! Go easy on it or your rice and chicken will be over powered. I forgot to mention that to one diner, they used a lot of the sauce, and they said it was too salty.
This was an excellent meal. It was a bit salty from the soy, but other than that it was very flavorful.
Great recipe
As per some of the other comments I halved the soy sauce and doubled the water, it was such an easy and tasty recipe. Very good!!
Did not care for this at all. It was way too salty.
I couldn't taste this due to a sinus infection, but my husband claimed it was excellent. I served this with a brown and wild rice pilaf and an apple salad.
I personally didn't enjoy this chicken, but everybody else LOVED it. Will make again, but without the extra sauce. The chicken was better without it.

This was absolutely delicious! In fact, I was so impressed with it that tonight I am making it for guests. It is our second time having it within four nights. The only thing I did differently was to leave out the salt since the soy sauce is salty enough already.
This one was ok. I liked the flavor. I did follow the suggestions and reduced the soy sauce. If I tried this again I'd use boneless chicken breast instead.

This was nice and easy to prepare. I used a whole cut frier that I skinned instead of boneless breasts. I found that cooking the chicken for 30 minutes plus 2 minutes on each side on the grill resulted in slightly over cooked rubbery chicken. Great flavor though! I'm glad that the weather was nice as I needed to air out the house...the smell is great, but very intense with the vinegar and soy. I will do this one again.
Very salty
My family and I love this recipe! It tastes just like my mom would make it except grilled! Great Idea!
A definite keeper!

AWESOME!! My sister in law is Philipino and made this often, but I never got the recipe for it. This is great! One thing I did differently(by mistake at first, but loved it), was grill the chicken first (I did it on the smoker) and then add to mixture to reduce sauce. The chicken really soaks up the flavor.YUM!

This was one of the saltiest dishes I've ever tasted. I should have looked at the nutrition link before I made it. 116% of the RDA for Sodium. 116% of your DAILY allowance of sodium...WOW! This went basically in the trash. Yuck.

I followed the recipe with low sodium soy sauce and reduce it to 1 cup and it came out yummy, although it looked a little different than the picture....mine didn't have that red color to it. It was more a brown. Grilling it really made the difference. We were in the middle of a huge snow storm so I used an indoor grill.

I just made this for dinner and I'm sorry to say that it was horrible. Way, way TOO SALTY. I only used 1 cup of reduced sodium soy sauce and increased the water portion by 1/2 cup and it was still too salty. Then we grilled it and it came out BLACK after 2 1/2 minutes, it was ridiculous. We almost threw the whole thing away but felt too guilty to do so and the bad part is... we still have a ton of leftovers. Very disappointing.
